column4: is there any way possible to install the fglrx driver on hardy without reformatting and doing it on gutsy where things work?
if we're lucky, maybe the next release of ubuntu (october something according to wikipedia) will actually be stable
I have not been enjoying hardy at all
i was as i could view flash and java fine with a 64bit browser, but the driver issues have been getting worse and worse. It's too much work just to keep your system running now.
just before I went back to dapper I was thinking I was spending tooo much time trying to get hardy working
i might just build my own kernel after all this mess. It's rediculous. I've been having more hardware issues on ubuntu than software issues on windows... That's sayin' soemthing.
I believe it is the new x that is the issue
new X? Why would you want to update a system that works?
afaik they are trying to have it configure itself at every boot instead of using xorg.conf

that's stupid. The thing could never configure itself correctly in the first place. Why the heck would anyone want to not have a config file to overwrite it with? Isn't that one of the glories of linux, to modify things however you want?
my sentiment exactly - best its' autoconfig could give me was 640x480
the best it could do for me was a resolution not even supported by my card. I can't even easily describe what happens
hardy made me glad I back up things like xorg.conf
that gave me an idea... maybe i have an old xorg.conf file... But i doubt i'm that lucky
